name: Jazzpunk: Director's Cut
description: Jazzpunk is a comedy adventure set in an alternate reality Cold War World, plagued with corporate espionage, CyberCrime, and sentient martinis. Gameplay is inspired by spoof comedy films and cartoons of yesteryear, with a focus on weird gadgets, exotic locales, and open-world style exploration.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP2 or higher Processor: 1.80GHz Processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Video card with 512MB of VRAM Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: A psychedelic drug trip through the 50’s or so it seems, Jazzpunk is packed with many little humorous things to discover, weird people to meet, and fun levels to visit. So put on your crazy hat, sit back and enjoy.  You are Polyblank who is sent on missions to recover some stolen goods and discover some things are not what they seem. There is voice acting while words are projected onto the characters and areas around the screen. You can do weird things like clean out a guy’s bat ears with a giant q-tip you find on the ground. Many funny stuff happens in this game that had me laughing many times. My kids watched some of it too and really got a kick out of it. Why not get in a pillow fight and knock the girl out the window or spray pigeon perfume on someone and watch the pigeons attack. These are just a few funny things to see.  The game is short though and can be finished in about 3-4 hours but that won’t take away and fun or experience. The $15 price tag is a little high but if you catch this on sale pick it up because it is a great game to experience. I would have loved to play more and hope maybe the devs will put out some add-on content or maybe a sequel. Probably won’t happen but I can always dream. It reminded me of Thirty Flights of Loving with its art style and somewhat similar story telling. Also if you are an achievement hunter they are all pretty easy to achieve and also fun to earn. Don’t miss out on this must play game.  Bear Rating: 9/10

Jazzpunk is a fun game, but after playing through and analyzing my 2 hours spent playing it, no, I wouldn't recommend it.  You'll have a few consecutive thoughts while playing this game:  1. Wow, what a silly, quirky and unique game.  2. This is getting kind of repetitive, but the NPCs say amusing things. 3. How long is this game? 4. Oh good, it's over.  The game started off well but quickly fell into a funk of bland. It's good that it's short, but that hinders the idea of paying $15 for this. If given a chance, I wouldn't have paid more than 5.   Also, I ran into a few bugs. Stuff like getting knocked off the map, having to restart a chapter because I did something out of the linear order, and the game completely locking up.
One of the weirdest and most interesting games I've ever played.
I have epilepsy and I have literally never run into an issue with games or movies in the past 10 years until I found Jazzpunk. I can't get through the intro and you can't skip it, this sucks

This game has a minigame where you get to play as a cat rampaging through an apartment in first-person perspective. It's a good game.  Must-have if you're into absurdity/surrealism/parodies and artsy games.
What an interesting game.

This was really fun to play and then I forgot to save and went to bed - that's fine though; two hours gone but my fault.  I then started the game again the following morning and in 30 minutes I had made all the progress I had in 2 hours back. Only then to find I was at the end of the game anyway. How short is this game? The screenshots on the Steam Slideshow Gallery in this page pretty much show you one scene from every mission, there are 4 in total. It's like all the effort was put into the real world trailer because that lasted as long as the entire play through.   I payed £5.50 on the Steam Sale, I wouldn't recommend unless it's down to £2.50 or less. The ending doesn't even wrap up the story either...
TL;DR

It's probably the only game that's ever made me actually laugh besides stick of truth, most quirky based comedy games only rely on observational comedy about video games themselves in which the jokes are very obvious and generic. This game however has actual non video game related comedy with proper diversity in the jokes.  But the game is WAY TOO SHORT. In the 3 or so hours of actual playtime I've finished the game twice and gotten all the achievements, the only way you can take a long time on a mission is by over analysing an objective. This game is too overpriced for it's content and should only be gotten on sale or in a bundle.

This game is fantastic.   It is a hilarious firstperson puzzler that has a unique art style and loads of secrets to find. It even reminds me of vintage first person shooter games because of the design and amount of secrets. However, it is quite short, it took me a bit more than 2 hours to complete the whole game, find lots of secrets, and 100% the achievements so I would recommend it only if it goes on sale for under 5$.  8.5/10
More computer punks then you can fit on a NES cartridge.  10/10

Honestly... It's a fun game to play. The idea of the side quests is pretty cool and it's not laggy. You get to do fun things while in game and it doesn't have anything scary or annoying in it. One things tho, it's very short and I think it should've costed like 5 or 6 dollars, maybe 4, not 15... If there were more levels I wouldn't have complained about the price. I bought this game hoping it would be a long adventure but I finished the game in like and hour or two which. Overall it was good, I laughed a bit and it's not boring. But please fix the price...

This game's only issue? It's way too damn short. Otherwise, it's a cyberpunk fan's delight. I laughed really hard, and there's a billion pop culture and electronics and retro computing references. I totally recommend especially when discounted.
It's just... wow! So crazy, but so good. The design, music, conversations and expecially the humor! Humor! This game is full of humor and easter-eggs! Oh, I love this game!
This rich dude asked me to spray canned cheese all over his face.  10/10 Would do weird sex things again.

Jazzpunk is a short, mission based first person 'shooter'. Shooter isn't the right word here I guess, because you won't be shooting anyone here, and when you do (maybe 2-3x) it's just for the fun of it.   This game parodies a lot of games and movies from the 80's and 90's and does it in style. I must admit that I wasn't impressed by the graphics of the game when I first saw the screenshots, but after having played it it looks really sharp and clean. The NPC's are still roughly modeled, however, and I think they could've done a better job here, but that's debatable.  There are so many little details, scenes and easter eggs to be found that you can't help but smile if you understand a reference. I don't think a lot of people will be laughing out loud, it's just all too random.  There are, technically, 4 levels to complete (if you count the mini levels it's a bit higher, of course) and each of them can be completed in around 30 minutes. So it isn't a long game. In fact, I think you can finish it within an hour if you just rush through it, but trust me, it's worth it to touch/activate/etc. as much as you can, and just play around with stuff. For a game this random I was surprised to actually find a semi decent story here. It won't blow anyone away, but considering the context of the game it's kinda fun.  If you like weird and random games play Jazzpunk. It's also good if you want to relax. You can take your time doing things, and you're not being pushed forward every 2 minutes. Yes,... yes, I think I like Jazzpunk.  [Rating: 76/100]

This is one of the most amazing games ever made. I've never laughed so hard, or had so much fun playing a video game before. The awesome humor never stops and the complete randomness of the game keeps you on your toes, and your gut laughing. This game is pure FUN.
amazing game dont rush the campaing explore around the map and do sidequests

I can count the number of times I've played a game and described it as genuinely funny. Lots of games can be amusing because of their direction, or incidentally funny because of something I did compared to the game itself.  But Jazzpunk is  actually  funny. As in within the first few minutes of booting up the game, their first few jokes already had me chuckling it up.  Just remember to think of Jazzpunk as an old-school adventure game, what with you going around touching and grabbing everything in an effort to trigger progress. But in the meantime, as you do that dreaded thing adventure games often make you do and  touch - EVERY - THING  to make sure you don't miss anything, Jazzpunk throws lots of great jokes and gags into every nook and cranny to fill your search.
It's bloody mental it is.

If you like joy, buy this game. Well... Jazzpunk is the kind of game that is either gonna click with you or not.This game is basically an interactive version of Mel Brooks or Leslie Nielson style spoof movies like the Naked Gun or Spaceballs. If that sounds appealing to you then, ♥♥♥♥ing buy this game or not. If your hesitant, watch the Giant Bomb Quick Look of this game until you decide whether or not this is your thing. Even though Jazzpunk is only 2-3 hours long, it's jam packed with jokes at quite literally every ♥♥♥♥ing turn. The mechanics are thin but the point isn't super deep or engaging gameplay; it's laughing your ♥♥♥ off.

WTF did I just play? And more importantly: Why The F*** are you not playing this?  This really deserves all the thumbs up you can get. It's basically an exploration game. Or even a walking simulator, as there is no way to actually fail. But the comedy is good enough not only to keep you playing but to cheer you up in a way few other games manage to do. And that's actually kind of surprising, seeing how jokes about computers, video games or old detective stories aren't exactly new. Some examples:  -your chief asks you to sit down in a stern voice...but there's a farting pillow on your seat -cyber sex if you insert a coin in a fembot -WEDDING QUAKE! -(from the credits) 'stunts performed by...unpaid interns'  And so on. About the only game that comes close to comparison (that I know) are Wario's minigames, but those who've played that know that these sorts of games are unique in and of themselves. So all I can say is that the building quality is decent and that the jokes are good ones. Sure, it's not very long. But on a game like this, one shouldn't expect that.

honestly, i love the raw humour. i love how it's played so straight. it honestly feels like what a game made by tim & eric might feel like, and i love that. it's weird humour, i think you pretty much like it or you don't. there's no real middle ground.  based upon what i've played so far, i'd say that if you're into tim & eric's humour (awesome show, check it out! with steve brule, tom goes to the mayor) you'd really like this game.

A comedic take on the Cold War espionage.    A little side note: This game may cause severe motion sickness. The movement is a little bit jerky, the graphics can be nauseating, not to mention the narrow FOV which is not changeable. You can try turning off mouse smoothing and sitting away as far as you can from the screen. Other than that, it's not worth playing if you have a history with motion sickness from playing games.
WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥ I AM PLAYING?! 10/10

Confuses droping genre references for laughs, and mini games aping better games for content. Couple that with deliberatly ugly graphics and a grating soundtrack I probably would have given up entirely if the main story line wasn't over inside a couple of hours.   If you're looking for the laughs of the point and click adventure games of old, I'd fire up ScummVM and replay The Secret of Monkey Island one more time.
this game is hillarious, I'm to busy laughing to write a real review so just buy the game
Works great on Linux, is packed with humor but lacks Steam Cloud support for the saved game progress.
I have no explaination as to what this game is about and what it's goals are. It's random, deadpan and satirical.
I loved every minute of this game, hilarious references everywhere. If you're a fan of Gravity bone you will love this,
The funniest most absurd ♥♥♥♥ i've ever played. It took me a while to get the hang of the gameplay mechanics but the humor in this masterpiece is unparalleled.

'Jazzpunk is a comedy adventure set in an alternate reality Cold War World, plagued with corporate espionage, CyberCrime, and sentient martinis. Gameplay is inspired by spoof comedy films and cartoons of yesteryear, with a focus on weird gadgets, exotic locales, and open-world style exploration.' -Please read the entirety of the review for all considerations-  The Cold War era and corporate-espionage themes are nice and not common in games. There is, mixed in, a world where technological integration and a feeling of publicity in every action taken is felt. The locations visited in the game, especially if they are actually named their alternative national names (in a 'mission' where you fly to your location) are a nice variety. That being said, for the gameplay; there is a good amount to see on each level and a nice artistic style. While the levels are decent, they tend to be relatively short considering how many levels there are in the game. With a dozen or so levels (there I told you how many there are): some can be completed in a manner of minutes- even one that can be completed in seconds (the 'mission' where you fly to your location). This game relies on the side-missions or exploring the locations to add gameplay, as doing the objective straight-forward results in a even-moreso short game. The game story is spy-ish and that's nice and all, but with little context as to what you are actually doing and an ending that says 'this could be explained later' but, as of September 2015, has no additional missions or follow-up.   For 15 US dollars, this game is short in gameplay and (frankly) not a high gameplay-to-dollar ratio. I have, as of this review, 3.1 hours into the game: and that includes two runs of the entire game, exploring the entirety of each map; playing the joke mini-games, like Wedding Qake, several times; and replaying select levels to do all the mini-games over again, like the 'boss level' and the 'vacation resort' locations.  That being said, for the good quality and detail and fun this game has, for 15 dollars I would not recommend this game until, either, there is a sale or some sort of additional gameplay bundled with it.
Very short. Filled with content throughout. Silly Humor. Contains Vore.
4 hours of point and click/3d adventure game gameplay filled with gags that almost all work. Hilarious start to finish.
this game was super funny, if you spend time looking though the levels you will find lots of cool stuff, and its worth buying
This games humour and style had me enjoying every moment. Who doesn't want to be a special agent in an alternative cold war universe.
I don't always love indie, FPS, Adventure, Humor games, but when I do, it's this one.  ~polyblank 10/10
What am i doing with my life.

An odd, surreal, colorful world, the first thing you'll notice about this game is just how creatively bizarre it is. It's strangely familiar with many of its elements and homages, and yet when it mixes them all up you still feel a breath of creativeness shine through. If you enjoyed things like old 60's cartoons or shows with their campiness, and love tongue in cheek humour, this is a great game for that. It also reminded me a bit of the Venture Bros., with the tone of everything satirizing and poking fun at the 'cartoons of yesteryear'.  The humour and art direction are indeed the strongest points to this game. If you're looking for a plot, however, I would say this doesn't really have much of one, aside from glimpses of the world they live in. The writing is at its strongest with humour, which is what the game 100% is.  Unfortunately, the game is very short, at most 2 hours, and not much replay value unless you like to experience it again after a long time or 100% the game. I recommend it solely off of the fact that it is an extremely funny game, but I would not pick it up for its full price of $15. Pick it up for when it's under $5, preferably around $3. It is well worth that price in broken sides and laughs alone.
Silly, funny, fun, amazing game.

I had a really good time with this game. It looks great, it gets really phycadelic and its really funny. Silly funny like shoving a tooth brush into a mans face till he dies. its 4 hours long but it never gets boring. Get this on sale I woulnt pay more than £6 for it. 8/10 :D xx
To anyone who doesn't own this game, change that. Immediately. You need this in your life.  To the makers of this game, more please. Lots more.  Gonna go play some more Wedding Qake now...

Jazzpunk... I really don't know how to describe how good it is, since the game makes no sense. But it is brilliant. It looks and feels like a longer version of Gravity Bone by Blendo Games. It has comedy, it has puzzles (even though they're very easy to do) and for a discounted price, it has a decent short-game play-time. I finished the story and all achievements in a matter of hours (because I was doing the story, achievements and random exploring all at once).  If this on sale and happens to be on your wishlist, get it. If you're like me and you like games that don't take themselves seriously, click buy.
The damn game is so cool

An odd, surreal, colorful world, the first thing you'll notice about this game is just how creatively bizarre it is. It's strangely familiar with many of its elements and homages, and yet when it mixes them all up you still feel a breath of creativeness shine through. If you enjoyed things like old 60's cartoons or shows with their campiness, and love tongue in cheek humour, this is a great game for that. The humour and art direction are indeed the strongest points to this game. The writing is at its strongest with humour, which is what the game 100% is. This is a short but very funny game, been a while since a game has made me laugh multiple times and this game did that for me. If you do end up buying it make sure you explore, you'll find a lot of hidden gems which make the game that more enjoyable. Definitely pick this up if it's on sale.

This Game is great, Its an amazing game for people who have abstract humors and love random and stupid funny jokes. that being said the game is about 2 hours long and 3 hours to 100% it which is a good thing or bad thing depending on how you look at it. And I did encounter many bugs during my playthrough two of which made me need to reload a save but even when the game glitched out i still could not stop laughing. I would pick it up when its on sale. but all in all its great game and one you should pick up. 9/10
if you want a funny but shorter game here is one for you, jazzpunk is a funny refernce filled game that will make you laugh
Really great game. I enjoyed it heaps. The fun little mini games and all the extra things for you to explore really made me laugh :D
Just play i can't exsplain what this is.

Firstly, it is hard to be serious about this game, it throws humor at you from just about any realm of interest. The game is about thirty to forty-five minutes long in the story length but you will spend some time admiring the world or just laughing at the random occurences. The story is nothing special but filled with jokes and references to easily find this entertaining. This game does what a video game should do, entertain the player and provide maybe some challenge but makes the experience memorable and fun. I would recommend this game to anyone that wants to just play a casual and humorous game.
I used a hot tub to blend up some people and gave it to a woman telling her it was a bloody mary. She loved it... 9/10
'LSD and Videogames make a great combo'  10/10 - IGN
You like fun and want to experience the roblox equivilent of tripping balls, well here you go.

Did you play any of those  Living Books  games as a kid? Did you compulsively click on every single thing to see the wacky funny stuff happen? Do you tire of 'comedy' adventure games just having the character make some pithy comment whenever you try to click on something that's not story-related and wish those things actually, you know,  did  stuff?  Welcome to  Jazzpunk , a game designed exactly for people like you! The campaign is short and simple, but the missions are packed with sidequests, minigames, and wacky interactababable objects and characters (who may or may not also be objects). Click all the things! Get all the achievements! For once it'll actually be worthwhile! But be warned: You'll wish it was longer, and it might just ruin traditional adventure games for you forever.

This is a short but very funny game, been a while since a game has made me laugh multiple times and this game did that for me. If you do end up buying it make sure you explore, you'll find a lot of hidden gems which make the game that more enjoyable. Definitely pick this up if it's on sale.

A complete journey into the center of the WTF universe. Nothing will or should make sense, always spank the robot sex workers and everybody loves pigeon Pie. it's hillarious, utterly unique and enjoyable though a bit short.
5/5 Killed Pizza Zombies with a pizzacutter. Easy to 1OO% and enjoyable.
Too much to pay for only ~ 2 hours of gameplay
2.5 hours of roller-pig-roasting perfection
Jazzpunk is a short game, however it's packed with hilarious characters, a great atmosphere, and a lot of amusing moments.

I'm usually all for wierd games, but this one achieves nothing else. It's ridiculous and absurd, and while I'd generally say those are good things, there is simply nothing else behind this game. This one feels like the devs just put random ideas together without much thought. At first it's funny, but after a while it just gets boring. It's like a series of absurd slapstick jokes through crappy graphic lenses.

What could have been a really interesting and engrossing experience just left me feeling like I'd been lied to. You know all that kooky stuff you see in the trailer, that sets you up for a super psychadelic experience? Yeah, pretty much none of it actually happens in the game. No using turtles, no flying brains, and the skycar section is literally about 10 seconds long and basically on rails.   It's good for what it is, but the trailer is just flat-out dishonest and you'll breeze through this in an hour and a half. Get it on a sale.
Great game! i loved it :D
Like Skyrim with guns Actually like taking an acid trip through James Bond-Warioware Hell

This is the only game that after I finished playing I said 'That's it?' and then proceeded to vomit.  Yes I actually vomited.  This game made me so god damn motion sick I can't even explain to you. Not only that but it made me want to seize up and roll around on the floor like a dog with a grand mal.  But in all seriousness, I would NEVER buy this game for it's full retail value of USD15$, I got it with a humble bundle, so i guess i lucked out, only has a 40 minute storyline that makes you feel like you're on LSD the whole time   6/10 for good story,   +1 for only game that has actually made me vomit

Jazzpunk is quite unique. It's really fun to look at, it's odd and absurd, which is great, but for me it goes nowhere with it.   I am going to give it a thumbs down because: 1) It takes no effort or thought to play. I have clicked everything, played all the mini games, searched every corner, gotten all the achievements and feel like I didn't do anything worthwhile when all is said and done. 2) The humor was not my kind of humor and it's unrelenting. That's a problem since humor seems to be half the game content (the other half are the visuals). For the most part, it is a continuous stream of computer-geek puns. IE: You go into a restaurant and the waitress says 'I will be your dedicated server.' Lots and LOTS of that. There is almost no dialogue per se, just a lot of word play. 3) The game made me feel ill which really surprised me. If you play for more than 30 minutes in a go, especially after the first chapter, most likely you will end up with a degree of motion sickness no matter how rarely you get it in real life. This game could probably be weaponized for that ability. 4) The game is very very short, though given everything else, that is sort of a plus.   I kept expecting something in the game to wow me, to grab me mentally at least once, but nothing ever did. It's colorful fluff. If you like computer puns and pure silliness -- you'll probably have a great time. If you want more from a game than just being taken on a ride, or if puns make you roll your eyes and sigh in annoyance -- then you probably want to give the game a miss.
go fast by jumpnig
Probably the most surreal game I have ever played in my entire life. A fun game to blow through in an afternoon with plenty of gags and easter eggs. Don't buy it full price; wait for a sale.
1950s-60s lounge aesthetic, robot detectives, and bad puns? SOLD. Get this game.
This game is so awesome that it made me pregnant and I'm a guy.
very normal
I don't know what I'm doing, but I'm doing the hell out of it and enjoying it.

I absolutely love this game in a way I wasn't expecting.  It has the right amount of humour and always in places you never expect to find it. You never know what you're going to come up against next, but you're guaranteed to laugh. Of course you could probably run straight through the game, do the tasks and finish it, but then you'd miss everything else going on. It's a game where you feel rewarded by looking at every little detail because so much of it has extra things to offer. It's not all in your face either, constantly forcing you to be in a typical funny situation. In fact a lot of the comedy in the game is quite subtle and you have to steer from the path in order to find it, but it makes you appreciate it as you play through. The attention to comedic detail is quite marvelous.  The gameplay is nice and simple. You walk around, interact with objects in often fun and ingenious ways to complete puzzles and make your way through the story. The graphics are very cartoony but still maintains a great atmosphere with all the music and extra sounds going on. It suits the tone of the game perfectly.  It's something nice, different and random. Nothing like I have played before and definitely a great experience. Would recommend.
Fantastic game, just stunning really. 12/10
You'll be playing this game and then WHOA there's a joke WHOA there goes another WHOA these just keep coming.
Not trying to say it's ♥♥♥♥ing weird.  ..But it's ♥♥♥♥ing weird. 10/10 would spend half an hour doing sidequests again.
very funny and enjoyable game but pretty short so maybe pick it up in a sale if that sort of things bothers you

First, I took some drugs. Next, I bought a hooker. After that, I went to a sushi bar and killed a man. Then I got super drunk, kissed some homeless guy, and turned this girl into a cannibal.  10/10 I lol'd

Hilarious! Art! These two words are ones almost never in the same sentence together, which is why I separated them with exclamation points. Separated or not though, Jazzpunk is both of these things. But to get to the point, (before I start talking about the weather or something, which i'm sure is nice where you live (if not, then I'm sure it's not nice (that is to say, I'm sure the weather is well weathered where you live (that really isn't what I was trying to say, but the 'weather is well weathered' pun is demonstrating the type of joke that can be found within Jazzpunk (You're welcome!))))) the real brilliance of Jazzpunk is how it frequently allows the player to transcend the main narrative in favour of allowing pointless exploration. The game itself is really more about the funny* hidden jokes than the silly storyline. So I only recommend this game if you have the patience to examine every little thing you come across. Or if you are an achievement hound. Because the achievements in this game are both numerous and drop-dead easy.  All in all, I had a great time with this title! 9/10!  *I take no responsibility for any un-funny jokes you come across. If you do come across an un-funny joke, don't message me with hate-mail telling me how much of a lying fool I am; instead take a step back** and re-evaluate your life.*** Look out the window! Watch the people outside swinging from tree to tree!**** Is it really worth the effort complaining to me!? The guy who will just delete your carefully worded hate message? And more importantly, maybe take a closer look and see if the joke you were complaining about is even really a joke! Not everything is you know. Unlike your life.*** #ohsnap  **Do NOT do this if you are standing on the edge of a cliff.  ***I write this based on the assumtion that you actually have a life. My apologies if I have misjudged you.  ****I write this based on the assumption that you live in an alternate universe where everyone is obsessed with George of the Jungle and favours vines and trees over cars and trains. My apoligies if I have misjudged you.

I love comedy, and I love stupid comedy, but this game tries to hard to be funny. If they had put more effort into actually making a game and less effort in terrible gags which aren't even funny in a cringeworthy way it might have been better. Visually it looks very good but it just fails as a game and it fails to be funny. It's 'annoying attention seeking kid that you want to punch every time he speaks' the game.
Awesome Time Killer! Wishing For More Level's Though.
This is hands down the weirdest game I've ever played and I love it. Who needs drugs when you can play this.
Do you like random hilarity? Then you will love jazzpunk

Jazzpunk is a comedy in the burgeoning sub genre of first person games like Gone Home or Thirty Flights of Loving that seek to tell a linear story in a non-linear experience by shepherding the protagonist with incentives. This review is the hardest review I've ever attempted to write. Being a comedy, and a video game, many of the jokes are deadpan and are uniquely structured to the levels of the game. Because of that there were levels that hit the mark, such as Wedding Quake were hilarious. Often times though there were jokes in levels that matched that were nearly identical to each other in structure, cadence and delivery right after each other that were not only not funny but actively served to make subsequent new jokes in that level less funny.  This fault of the game seems to be a result of the non-linear structure. Due to it being a non-linear game there are many chances to miss things. Due to this they would reuse minigames and even types of jokes. That said reused jokes can be funny. There are multiple instances where you are sent through a zombie pizza hut minigame trifle, and each time it gave me goosebumps and it would cause uncontrollable laughter. Most of the jokes are not given as much car as the pizza hut gag or Wedding Quake and are mere stand-up routines. There are instances when multiple non-player characters in levels will give similar routines but not quite the same, and these jokes fall flat.  Jazzpunk in many ways is a stark realization that game developers growing up playing Nintendo 64 games are now making games of their own. It’s a weird artifact from an era that went in a different direction, when minigames dominated and there were a torrent of incentives deployed at the player character to get them to complete a non-linear environment in a linear way. In the end, what this boils down to is a unique refreshing experience that's comedy doesn't hack it the whole way through.
This game may give you motion sickness. Many other players have complained about this. You have been warned.
Too much punk and not enough jazz. Interesting and surreal, but not all that fun after a couple of hours.

Quirky and fun, albeit short, game that's good if your looking for an hour or two to kill with some laughs. There's tons of little side things to explore and the art is unique and interesting, and most of the time your exploration is rewarded by the well-written comedy strewn about the game. Not a lot of games entice me to poke around every corner and click on everything like this one did. If this is your kind of humor, you'll probably love it. If not, well then you'll probably hate it.  Dunno if it's worth 15 dollars (the only reason I can think of why the price is so high is because the developers had to pay for A) Drugs that assisted with the creation of this game, or B) the Adult Swim logo.) but if you've got the extra cash and are prepared to throw it at your screen for a brief hour or two of complete and total confusion, then by all means try it out!  tl;dr This game broke my brain, rawr stars out of blarg.
Not worth the money

I love the bizzare theme, hilarious deadpan dialogue, and quirky style, but I can't reccomend it in good conscience becasue for some inexplicable reason I get nauseated every time I try to play it longer than 20 minutes. Oh well.
I got this from a humble bundle. I played it all the way through. I'm not sure what the hell the point was...
What am I playing.
This is far too bizarre to recommend, it's not much of a game either and the humour is pretty poor most of the time. If I was 12 it might work.
Quirky, funny, and awesome. The main draw here is exploring to see what wacky stuff you can find. Personally I thought this game was hillarious and well worth the money.
Fun, but not worth the price, buy it on sale.

Clocking in at under 3 hours, it's a little difficult to recommend Jazzpunk for the default price of 15 USD. The game is a dadaist paradise with much more under the hood than it initially appears, ping-ponging you from one insane mission or minigame to the next. It's a great game and a definite buy for under 10.

A cute casual game that reminds us just to have fun. No strategies, No complicated controls. Just sit back as the game brings you through colourful and wacky missions as you giggle at little old school gaming puns and nostalgia.
Gloriously bizarre.

Wow, that was a lot shorter than I was expecting or hoping for. It's clear a lot of effort went into it but it's just too short for the price. I'm bummed that it ended so soon because I enjoyed what there was of it.

Weird, wacky and wonderful. I can't think of a better way to waste my afternoon with my pants on.  This is a fine addition to Adult Swim's stable of games. The opening sequence is inspired and is a demonstration of what can be done with minimalist graphics. The game play is straight foward and somewhat linear. I will play through again to pick up those little bits here and there I missed the first time. The humour is spot on and you'll probably find yourself laughing out loud at some of the silliness.   My only complaint is the abruptness with which the game ends. Hopefully there will be DLC to expand the missions and fun.
If you play games you should also play this game.
reminds me of the simpler times and forth wall breaks and gameplay that makes me genuinely laugh
jazzpunk is like walking in a bar and an hour later youre car is broken because you hit a tree.  why? because why not. ♥♥♥♥ you jazzpunk

Great game, very short however. Yeah, I've played about 2 hours at the time of this review, and that is time that is also bundled into just exploring the game. This game could easily be beaten 45 - 60 minutes tops if you don't explore / mess around.  For the price, the game is really good. Could be longer, but it was worth it. I recommend this to people to who replay their games to explore :)
I loved this game personally. It had a weird ending though I still enjoyed it.   TheOnlyMaestro
Just buy it

If you are like me (a wierd ♥♥♥ college student who goes on the internet way too much) then this game is for you. Pure ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles fun.
this is a good game

Its a strange game that feels like a cross between an acid trip and a james bond fan fiction. Its funny but sometimes I felt that it tries a little too hard to be funny. Its also kind of short and you can breeze through the game in one sitting. Get it on a steam sale, its not really worth it at full price but its a nice little distraction for a few hours.
It's a swing thing.
this is da ♥♥♥♥

I want to like Jazzpunk, but I don't. The concept seems really cool, and the world is ridiculous and hilarious, but the art style and the music are grating and break my will to actually play it. I can't imagine ever getting through the game.

Just watch Dunkey's video on the game instead. Every joke that doesn't fall completely flat is already spoiled by it, and frankly his delivery's better than the game's.  Don't waste your time or money on this. It's $15 for a 2 hour (being generous on this, btw) point and click.

very hit and miss style of humor. It's really only this. There is nothing at the end that makes you think. Sometimes I found the game to be quite exhausting, because you get bombardeded with hilarious/senseless jokes/references.  The camera placement and moving gave me headaches and made me sick (I'm ususally not the type, that has problems with mostion sickness).  It's like one of these joke-books with bad jokes in it and quite a waste of 2 hours of your time if you can't connect with the type of humor. The Gameplay (simple mini-games) isn't very enjoyable either.  Even for the 9 € I've paid it's quite pricey :/
